channel.title: Being a virgin?
channel.description:
Sex before your 20 y'o.
I'd do it :D
But srsly, is it right for 12 year old to have sex too?
DEBATE NOW.

item.title: Being a virgin?
item.dc:creator: @Evan1 Evan`
item.description:
@Evan1 wrote:

[quote=“zoss0, post:521, topic:136548”][quote author=Original Daniel link=topic=188075.msg2217540#msg2217540 date=1210336795]
I still say a girl can’t lose her virginity to a curb.

vir·gin Audio Help /ˈvɜrdʒɪn/ Pronunciation Key - Show Spelled Pronunciation[vur-jin] Pronunciation Key - Show IPA Pronunciation
–noun

  1. a person who has never had sexual intercourse.

[quote=“Wikipedia”]In the majority of women, the hymen is sufficiently vestigial as to pose no obstruction to the entryway of the vagina. The presence of a broken hymen may therefore indicate that the vagina has been penetrated but also that it was broken via physical activity or the use of a tampon or dildo. Many women possess such thin, fragile hymens, easily stretched and already perforated at birth, that the hymen can be broken, or merely disappear, in childhood, without the woman’s even being aware of it.

In contrast to the common cases of an absent or partial hymen, in rare cases a woman may possess an imperforate hymen, such as prevents the release of menstrual discharge. A surgical procedure known as hymenotomy, which creates an opening in the hymen, is sometimes required to avert deleterious health effects. The playwright Ben Jonson claimed that Queen Elizabeth I of England, the Virgin Queen, had a “membranum” that made her “incapable of Man”, and that a friend of hers, a “chirurgeon”, had offered to remedy the problem with his scalpel and that Elizabeth had demurred.

The presence of a hymen is a possible indication, but no guarantee, of virginity, given that it is speculated that some degree of sexual activity may occur without rupturing the hymen and because there may exist varying definitions as to the type and extent of sexual activity that is required to terminate the state of “virginity”.[/quote]
[/quote]
That’d kinda suck, losing your “Virginity” to a … piece of concrete…O_O if you think that way.

Good statement though - you can’t argue with that.[/quote]Guys loose there virginity to bagels and donuts.

Read full topic

–noun

  1. a person who has never had sexual intercourse.

[quote=“Wikipedia”]In the majority of women, the hymen is sufficiently vestigial as to pose no obstruction to the entryway of the vagina. The presence of a broken hymen may therefore indicate that the vagina has been penetrated but also that it was broken via physical activity or the use of a tampon or dildo. Many women possess such thin, fragile hymens, easily stretched and already perforated at birth, that the hymen can be broken, or merely disappear, in childhood, without the woman’s even being aware of it.

In contrast to the common cases of an absent or partial hymen, in rare cases a woman may possess an imperforate hymen, such as prevents the release of menstrual discharge. A surgical procedure known as hymenotomy, which creates an opening in the hymen, is sometimes required to avert deleterious health effects. The playwright Ben Jonson claimed that Queen Elizabeth I of England, the Virgin Queen, had a “membranum” that made her “incapable of Man”, and that a friend of hers, a “chirurgeon”, had offered to remedy the problem with his scalpel and that Elizabeth had demurred.

The presence of a hymen is a possible indication, but no guarantee, of virginity, given that it is speculated that some degree of sexual activity may occur without rupturing the hymen and because there may exist varying definitions as to the type and extent of sexual activity that is required to terminate the state of “virginity”.[/quote][/quote]i can’t argue with that. gj.

item.description:

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:520, topic:136548”]I still say a girl can’t lose her virginity to a curb.

vir·gin Audio Help /ˈvɜrdʒɪn/ Pronunciation Key - Show Spelled Pronunciation[vur-jin] Pronunciation Key - Show IPA Pronunciation
–noun

  1. a person who has never had sexual intercourse.

[quote=“Wikipedia”]In the majority of women, the hymen is sufficiently vestigial as to pose no obstruction to the entryway of the vagina. The presence of a broken hymen may therefore indicate that the vagina has been penetrated but also that it was broken via physical activity or the use of a tampon or dildo. Many women possess such thin, fragile hymens, easily stretched and already perforated at birth, that the hymen can be broken, or merely disappear, in childhood, without the woman’s even being aware of it.

In contrast to the common cases of an absent or partial hymen, in rare cases a woman may possess an imperforate hymen, such as prevents the release of menstrual discharge. A surgical procedure known as hymenotomy, which creates an opening in the hymen, is sometimes required to avert deleterious health effects. The playwright Ben Jonson claimed that Queen Elizabeth I of England, the Virgin Queen, had a “membranum” that made her “incapable of Man”, and that a friend of hers, a “chirurgeon”, had offered to remedy the problem with his scalpel and that Elizabeth had demurred.

The presence of a hymen is a possible indication, but no guarantee, of virginity, given that it is speculated that some degree of sexual activity may occur without rupturing the hymen and because there may exist varying definitions as to the type and extent of sexual activity that is required to terminate the state of “virginity”.[/quote][/quote]
That’d kinda suck, losing your “Virginity” to a … piece of concrete…O_O if you think that way.

Good statement though - you can’t argue with that.

item.title: Being a virgin?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

I still say a girl can’t lose her virginity to a curb.

vir·gin Audio Help /ˈvɜrdʒɪn/ Pronunciation Key - Show Spelled Pronunciation[vur-jin] Pronunciation Key - Show IPA Pronunciation
–noun

  1. a person who has never had sexual intercourse.
In the majority of women, the hymen is sufficiently vestigial as to pose no obstruction to the entryway of the vagina. The presence of a broken hymen may therefore indicate that the vagina has been penetrated but also that it was broken via physical activity or the use of a tampon or dildo. Many women possess such thin, fragile hymens, easily stretched and already perforated at birth, that the hymen can be broken, or merely disappear, in childhood, without the woman's even being aware of it.

In contrast to the common cases of an absent or partial hymen, in rare cases a woman may possess an imperforate hymen, such as prevents the release of menstrual discharge. A surgical procedure known as hymenotomy, which creates an opening in the hymen, is sometimes required to avert deleterious health effects. The playwright Ben Jonson claimed that Queen Elizabeth I of England, the Virgin Queen, had a “membranum” that made her “incapable of Man”, and that a friend of hers, a “chirurgeon”, had offered to remedy the problem with his scalpel and that Elizabeth had demurred.

The presence of a hymen is a possible indication, but no guarantee, of virginity, given that it is speculated that some degree of sexual activity may occur without rupturing the hymen and because there may exist varying definitions as to the type and extent of sexual activity that is required to terminate the state of “virginity”.

Read full topic

item.title: Being a virgin?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Intercourse is the only way anyone can lose their virginity. Sex != bj or hand job. The only people who think otherwise are the misinformed and the 13 year olds who got a hand job and want to tell people they aren’t virgins.

exe626:

for a girl, you should know, is still a virgin until that thin layer of skin is broken. a man can lose his virginity in a number of ways.

A (virgin) girl I knew back in the day stacked it roller blading, she landed on a curb and broke her hymen. By your logic she lost her virginity to a curb?

A girl can also get fingered and have her hymen broken, and still be a virgin because it wasn’t a penis.

Read full topic

item.description:

Original Daniel:

I don’t know how it can be any more straight forward than “a virgin is someone who hasn’t had sex”

Cowie`:

In England, the law will not / can’t press any charges on two minors of the same age, both admitting to having sexual intercourse if the decision was by themselfs, with no pressure or force being used, mentally or physically, by either party.

Cool.
